Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Braids of hair
Description: This is a grouping of eleven relatively short braids of brown hair. None of the extremities of these braids appear to have been originally cut. All strands are braided fairly tightly, except one that is much looser. This set of braids was found near the head of the deceased of tomb 58, a presumably female adult.
